meanings.definition: A person who uses a bridle to control a horse.
meanings.sent1: The skilled bridlers gently guided the horse along the trail.
meanings.sent2: The bridlers in the stable took care of the horses every day.
meanings.sent3: The bridlers had a race to see who could control their horses the best.
meanings.sent4: She was the bridlers of her own destiny, steering her life in the direction she wanted.
meanings.sent5: The bridlers held the reins firmly, ensuring the horse followed their lead.

meanings.definition: Plural form of the word 'bridler', meaning someone who controls or restrains.
meanings.sent1: The bridlers in the group were responsible for keeping everyone in line.
meanings.sent2: The bridlers at the event ensured that order was maintained throughout.
meanings.sent3: The bridlers at the party had a tough job keeping the guests from getting too rowdy.
meanings.sent4: In the chaos, she stood out as the bridlers, calming the situation with her presence.
meanings.sent5: The bridlers of the team were praised for their ability to handle difficult situations.
